name: py-pyedr

variants.name: build_system
variants.description: Build systems supported by the package

description:
Pyedr provides a means of reading a Gromacs EDR binary XDR file and
return its contents as a dictionary of NumPy arrays

dependencies.name: py-mda-xdrlib
dependencies.description: A stand-alone XDRLIB module extracted from CPython 3.10.8

dependencies.name: py-numpy
dependencies.description: Fundamental package for array computing in Python.

dependencies.name: py-pbr
dependencies.description:
PBR is a library that injects some useful and sensible default behaviors
into your setuptools run.

dependencies.name: py-pip
dependencies.description: The PyPA recommended tool for installing Python packages.

dependencies.name: py-setuptools
dependencies.description:
A Python utility that aids in the process of downloading, building,
upgrading, installing, and uninstalling Python packages.

dependent_to.name: py-panedr
dependent_to.description:
Panedr uses the Pyedr library to read a Gromacs EDR binary energy XDR
file and returns its contents as a pandas dataframe

dependent_to.name: py-mdanalysis
dependent_to.description:
MDAnalysis is a Python toolkit to analyze molecular dynamics
trajectories generated by a wide range of popular simulation packages
including DL_Poly, CHARMM, Amber, NAMD, LAMMPS, and Gromacs. (See the
lists of supported trajectory formats and topology formats.)
